channel.title: DEVEN - Developer Enablement
channel.description: Developer for Developer to make your (work) life easier!

item.title: Newsletter 011
item.description:
‚ú® Happy 3-2-1 treats day!‚ú®

Good day everyone,

Welcome to the new format of the DEVEN newsletter. From now on the newsletter will be published as blog post on the DEVEN website. The old newsletters are also available as blog posts.

Here are 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them, we hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

How to exclude elements from being shown in google search results
https://www.stefanjudis.com/today-i-learned/how-to-exclude-elements-from-being-shown-in-google-search-results/

A new approach to container and wrapper classes
https://youtu.be/c13gpBrnGEw

htmx - high power tools for HTML
https://htmx.org/

2 things for doers

Popular git config options
https://jvns.ca/blog/2024/02/16/popular-git-config-options/

Create a Currency Converter with HTML, CSS, and Vanilla JavaScript üßÆ
https://webdesign.tutsplus.com/currency-converter-with-html-css-and-vanilla-javascript--cms-108362t

1 question for thinkers

"Forever projects" are things you start and want to continue forever or at least did not defined a shelf life for. And those things can be hard to let go. Do you have forever projects? https://www.stefanjudis.com/notes/forever-projects/


Thank you for reading!

If you have any resources you think your colleagues should know about, please let us know, so we can add it to a future newsletter.
Julian from DEVEN


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

üéÅ Below you will find a small coding challenge in every newsletter. Feel free to discuss the challenge with others/your juniors and trainees, with your team or even your cactus. üåµ
>> link to challenge <<
item.dc:creator: Julian Cebulla

item.title: Newsletter 010
item.description:
‚ú® Happy 3-2-1 treats day!‚ú®

Good day everyone,

Here are 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them, we hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

A Complete Guide to CSS Cascade Layers
https://css-tricks.com/css-cascade-layers/

Inside look at modern web browser
https://developer.chrome.com/blog/inside-browser-part1/

Resilience, Flexibility, And Immediacy: Working With Headless Systems
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/05/resilience-flexibility-immediacy-headless-systems/

2 things for doers

GPT + DALL-E + WhatsApp = AI Assistant üöÄ
https://github.com/askrella/whatsapp-chatgpt

#CodePenChallenge: Round
https://codepen.io/collection/NqyoLd

1 question for thinkers

How will AIs like ChatGPT change our way of working, and how will it change user interactions?


Thank you for reading!

If you have any resources you think your colleagues should know about, please hit reply and let us know, so we can add it to a future newsletter.
Julian & Ola from DEVEN


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

item.title: Newsletter 009
item.description:
‚ú® Happy 3-2-1 treats day!‚ú®

Good day everyone, Here are 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them, I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

The ‚Äòscrollend‚Äô event is coming
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/scrollend_event

üí°üéÅ JavaScript Visualized: Generators and Iterators
https://lnkd.in/gXFM9puE

How To Give Effective Feedback Remotely
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/05/give-effective-feedback-remotely/

2 things for doers

Validate and visualize dependencies. Your rules. JavaScript, TypeScript, CoffeeScript. ES6, CommonJS, AMD.
https://github.com/sverweij/dependency-cruiser

Interactive puppy, it wants to fetch your cursor ü¶¥üê∂
https://codepen.io/Ma5a/pen/MWBGbOb

1 question for thinkers

What are your primary goals, professionally and privately, for this new year? Who and what can help you to achieve them?


Thank you for reading!

If you have any resources you think your colleagues should know about, please hit reply and let us know, so we can add it to a future newsletter.
Julian & Ola from DEVEN


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

item.title: Newsletter 008
item.description:
‚ú® Happy 3-2-1 treats day!‚ú®

Happy new year üéâ With the new year we also start a new season of our newsletter to send you 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them, I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

‚è±Ô∏è Precise Timing With Web Animations API
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/06/precise-timing-web-animations-api/

How To Avoid Bias In Computer Vision Models
https://blog.roboflow.com/how-to-avoid-bias-in-computer-vision-models/

Microservices vs Monolithic Architecture: A Practical Approach
https://dev.to/lovepreetsingh/microservices-vs-monolithic-architecture-a-practical-approach-4m06

2 things for doers

Scroll Snap Type - Set snap points on scroll containers
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scroll-snap-type

SVG Gradient Wave Generator
https://codepen.io/supah/pen/prVVOx

1 question for thinkers

If you take a moment to reflect on what you accomplished in 2022, what are you the most proud of?


Thank you for reading!

If you have any resources you think your colleagues should know about, please hit reply and let us know, so we can add it to a future newsletter.

We wish you all a great start into the new year, let your dreams take flight in 2023!
Julian & Ola from DEVEN


P.S.: As promised we continue the coding challenges, this time we have one from @KrasimirTsonev who created a dedicated website with challenges.
Add a HTML element that allows the user to pick a colour
item.dc:creator: Julian Cebulla

item.title: Newsletter 007
item.description:
‚ú® Another round of 3-2-1 treats.‚ú®

Every few weeks, you will get 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them‚Ä¶ I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

How do I make sure my work is visible?
https://www.theengineeringmanager.com/qa/how-do-i-make-sure-my-work-is-visible/

An interactive guide to colour & contrast:
https://colorandcontrast.com/

‚ú®‚ôªÔ∏è JavaScript Visualised: Event Loop
https://lnkd.in/gVBuzDsg

2 things for doers

VueUse - Collection of Vue Composition Utilities
https://vueuse.org/

11ty - A simple static site generator
https://www.11ty.dev

1 question for thinkers

What can you do to take better care of yourself?


Thank you for reading!

This is the last newsletter for this year, but no worries it will continue next year with even more things to learn, do and think about. üéâ

If you have any resources you think your colleagues should know about, please hit reply and let us know, so we can add it to a future newsletter.

We wish you all happy holidays, take a break and enjoy the quiet time at the end of the year. ‚ô•Ô∏è
Ola & Julian from DEVEN


P.S.: We‚Äôll skip the coding challenge this time as we want you to take a break. We will continue them with the next newsletter, promised.

But we do have an ask‚Ä¶ if you are up to it: show appreciation to your colleagues for what they did this year, spread some love üíå
item.dc:creator: Julian Cebulla

item.title: Newsletter 006
item.description:
‚ú® Another round of 3-2-1 treats.‚ú®

Every 2 weeks, you will get 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them‚Ä¶ I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

‚ö°Ô∏è‚õìJavaScript Visualized: Scope (Chain)
https://lnkd.in/gEjUXsXu

The Basics of package.json
https://nodesource.com/blog/the-basics-of-package-json

Hiring technical talent: An exercise in clarity, patience, and preparation
https://github.com/readme/guides/hiring-technical-talent

2 things for doers

A GitHub repo with a lot of weird bash examples you can run on your computer
https://github.com/jvns/shell-examples

Common error types in one infographic
https://twitter.com/sumusiriwardana/status/1546399074244386818

1 question for thinkers

What defines your self-worth?


Thank you for reading! You‚Äôd love to participate, but to not know how. Simple‚Ä¶ Hit reply!

Talk soon! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Ola


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

üéÅ Below you will find a small coding challenge in every newsletter. Feel free to discuss the challenge with other/your juniors and trainees, with your team or even your cactus. üåµ

item.title: Newsletter 005
item.description:
‚ú® Another round of 3-2-1 treats.‚ú®

Every 2 weeks, you will get 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them‚Ä¶ I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

How do I make sure my work is visible?
https://www.theengineeringmanager.com/qa/how-do-i-make-sure-my-work-is-visible/

An interactive guide to colour & contrast:
https://colorandcontrast.com/

‚ú®‚ôªÔ∏è JavaScript Visualized: Event Loop
https://lnkd.in/gVBuzDsg

2 things for doers

Finds bugs in your shell scripts
https://www.shellcheck.net/

VueUse - Collection of Vue Composition Utilities
https://vueuse.org/

1 question for thinkers

Having issues changing your habit of using ‚Äúguys‚Äù when addressing a group of people? Changing habits is hard. Put a post-it on your computer with synonyms like ‚Äúfolks, team, peeps‚Ä¶‚Äù as a reminder.


Thank you for reading, but also for your feedback! Some of you mentioned, you‚Äôd love to participate, but to not know how. Simple‚Ä¶ Hit reply!

Talk soon! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Ola


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

item.title: Newsletter 004
item.description:
‚ú® Welcome to our series 3-2-1 treats.‚ú®

Every 2 weeks, you will get 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them‚Ä¶ I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

Your future self will thank you: Building your personal documentation -
https://github.com/readme/guides/private-documentation

Manage Accessible Design System Themes With CSS Color-Contrast()
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/05/accessible-design-system-themes-css-color-contrast/

Things I Wish I‚Äôd Known Earlier In My Career
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/06/things-to-know-earlier-in-your-career/

2 things for doers

Smoothly interpolate between variations of SVG paths
https://github.com/Minibrams/svg-path-morph

Parallax pure CSS
https://www.netlify.com/blog/fun-parallax-scrolling-css-for-matterday/

1 question for thinkers

How much downtime do you allow yourself without doom scrolling or binge-watching?


Thank you for reading! Now it‚Äôs your turn! What excites you at the moment? What did you enjoy today? Hit reply and let me know!

Talk soon! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Ola


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

üéÅ Below you will find a small coding challenge in every newsletter. Feel free to discuss the challenge with other/your juniors and trainees, with your team or even your cactus. üåµ
>> link to codepen <<

item.title: Newsletter 003
item.description:
‚ú® Welcome to our series 3-2-1 treats.‚ú®

Every 2 weeks, you will get 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them‚Ä¶ I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

Software Engineering - The Soft Parts
https://addyosmani.com/blog/software-engineering-soft-parts/

State is hard: why SPAs will persist
https://nolanlawson.com/2022/05/29/state-is-hard-why-spas-will-persist/

Best practices for inclusive CLIs
https://seirdy.one/posts/2022/06/10/cli-best-practices/

2 things for doers

Practical CSS and design tips that helps in building future-proof user interfaces.
https://defensivecss.dev/

A collection of bad practices in HTML, copied from real websites.
https://www.htmhell.dev/

1 question for thinkers

What scares you the most about making decisions?


Thank you for reading! Now it‚Äôs your turn! What excites you at the moment? What did you enjoy today? Hit reply and let me know!

Talk soon! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Ola


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

item.title: Newsletter 002
item.description:
‚ú® Welcome to our series 3-2-1 treats.‚ú®

Every 2 weeks, you will get 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day. No matter if you are a learner, a doer, a thinker, two or all of them‚Ä¶ I hope you‚Äôll find something to enjoy.

3 things for learners

ECMA International approves ECMAScript 2022: What‚Äôs new?
https://2ality.com/2022/06/ecmascript-2022.html

Don‚Äôt Sink Your Website With Third Parties
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/06/dont-sink-website-third-parties/

Simplify Your Color Palette With CSS Color-Mix()
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/06/simplify-color-palette-css-color-mix/

2 things for doers

Everything you need to know about mono repos, and the tools to build them.
https://monorepo.tools/

#HEXWORDS - Why bother with a random green when you can choose to be a #BADA55!
https://hexwords.netlify.app/

1 question for thinkers

I know, projects are very often pretty stressful. Together, everything seems easier.
So, ask yourself‚Ä¶ How can we support others?


Thank you for reading! Now it‚Äôs your turn! What are you working on? What‚Äôs the last thing you learned? What excites you at the moment?
Hit reply and let me know!

Talk soon! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Ola


P.S.: Do you love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you!

item.title: Newsletter 001
item.description:
‚ú® Welcome to our new series called 3-2-1 treats.‚ú®

Every 2 weeks, you will get 3 things for learners, 2 things for doers, and 1 question for thinkers to sprinkle some glitter on your day.

3 things for learners

How to break the cycle of tech debt.
https://leaddev.com/legacy-technical-debt-migrations/how-break-cycle-tech-debt

Avoiding layout shifts: aspect-ratio vs width & height attributes.
https://jakearchibald.com/2022/img-aspect-ratio/

The Future Of Frontend Build Tools.
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/06/future-frontend-build-tools/

2 things for doers

Touch friendly 3D parallax hover effects.

browsers.fyi - Current browser versions and release notes as site, feed or API.

1 question for thinkers

Do you remember your best mentor so far? What can you learn from this experience? Do you remember your worse mentor so far? What can you learn from this experience?


Thank you for reading! Now it‚Äôs your turn! What are you working on? What‚Äôs the last thing you learned? What excites you at the moment? Hit reply and let me know!

Talk soon! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Ola


P.S.: You love to challenge yourself a bit? Here is a small gift for you! üéÅ Below you will find a small coding challenge in every newsletter. Feel free to discuss the challenge with your/other juniors and trainees, with your team or even your cactus. üåµ
>> link to codepen <<
